Exporting or Importing a Chart

Using the Windows client, you can export and import charts. Using the Cross-Platform client, you can export a chart to a JPG file.

Using the Windows Client

The application allows you to save (or export) a chart to a file with the extension .chf. The file also contains the options used to create the chart.

To redisplay the chart later, simply import the .chf file. An imported chart with a legend always displays the legend at the right side of the chart window.

To export a chart:

  1. From the Chart window, click the Export Chart button on the toolbar. The Export Chart dialog opens.

  2. In the dialog box, provide the drive, directory, and file name for the chart.

  3. Select the type of file in the Save files as type box. The appropriate extension appears in the File name text box.

  4. Click OK.

To import a chart:

  1. From the Chart window, click the Import Chart button on the toolbar. The Import Chart dialog opens.

  2. In the dialog box, provide the drive, directory, and file name for the chart.

  3. Click Open.

Using the Cross-Platform Client

To export/save a chart as a JPG file:

  1. Click the Save chart as button on the toolbar. The Save As dialog opens.

  2. Enter a name for the file.

  3. Browse to or enter a path where you wish to save the JPG file.

  4. Click Save.
